item.title: Report E-2024030166
item.description:
Report E-2024030166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Dallas, TX; the spill consisted of approximately 1 gallon of C16 Racing Fuel (UN1203), which was released from a 2 gallon metal can due to a forklift puncture when loading. The terminal stated they cleaned the spill with Oil Dri prior to the call and placed the contents into a 5 gallon metal drum with plastic lining for disposal. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030148
item.description:
Report E-2024030148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured by a faulty pallet and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030159
item.description:
Report E-2024030159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, asphalt, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the dock floor, trailer interior and asphalt and swept them in with hand tools. The residual product within the punctured tote was emptied and transferred to a new 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged tote was deconstructed with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged on site

  • Description: A HAZMAT PACKAGE STARTED LEAKING. FOLLOWING DECISION TREE/RESPONSE SHEETS, RESPONDER USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX AT THE DMP PROCESS AREA, RESPONDER FOUND THAT 1 BOTTLE HAD CRACKED THAT THE REST WERE SOILED BY THE PRODUCT

item.title: Report X-2024021929
item.description:
Report X-2024021929

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN MESQUITE, TEXAS AN AIR PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING AT THE DELIVERY DESTINATION. RESPONDER INSPECTED TO FIND ONE GALLON OF NMD 80 NEW MASONRY DETERGENT REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION AS A CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A DANEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought up to Hazmat cage from local with report that package was found damaged when loading a delivery van. DescribePack: Most of the metal drum was covered in spilled yellow paint. Tracking number identified by OP-900 label and relabel. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Several thick bags were wrapped around the drum as it was brought to Hazmat cage. Package was placed into a salvage drum for inspection.

  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in QA damage area, then placed in a tote and moved to Hazmat area for inspection. DescribePack: Box was wet on one side. The 3 gallons were examined carefully. No active leakage was found. One was especially wet near the cap and testing strip indicated ph. 12-13. All 3 were still mostly full but soiled by the leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a tote lined with a thick bag. Bottles were placed in a salvage drum during inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024021783
item.description:
Report X-2024021783

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Metal drum was found on the floor wrapped in a plastic bag with spilled red paint inside near the conveyor belt coming from the unload. Drum was placed in a carrying tote lined with a Hazmat bag and moved to Hazmat cage. DescribePack: When lifted from the carrying tote, active leakage was seen coming from a crack at the base of the drum. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Drum was placed in a tote and moved to Hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024021761
item.description:
Report X-2024021761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: SHERMAN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Customer loaded trailer picked up and brought to station. Upon opening trailer, a QA admin found the package to be on its side with other non hazardous packages collapsed onto and around it. Customer failed to properly brace and secure the HazMat packages to prevent movement. DescribePack: Th seal under the screw-on cap is loose or completely detached on two of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All spillage was contained to the outer packaging without contaminating other packages. Box was turned upright and bagged and placed in a red haz tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021730
item.description:
Report X-2024021730

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Called to unload and found package leaking as the box was not loaded according to the shipping arrows which were pointing up, but box loaded on the side. Immediate in-house cleanup ensued. Box was loaded incorrectly from the hub. DescribePack: Because the box was loaded incorrectly, the drum inside leaked from the cap and spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: In-house cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024021727
item.description:
Report X-2024021727

  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024021727: SequenceEvent: The package was dropped off at the damaged hazmat cage, after a manager placed it in a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: A crack spanning half of the circumference of the bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a red damaged tote. X-2024021728: SequenceEvent: package was dropped off at the damaged hazmat cage, after manager placed it in a black tote. DescribePack: A crack spanning half of the circumference of the bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package had tape on the crack and was placed in a black damage tote.

The cap also leaks due to being loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed box in a lined hazmat tote bin and sent to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021647
item.description:
Report X-2024021647

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22

  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The leak, vapor released from the 4-bolt face plate that connects to the Manual Vent Valve (V-9L). The release amount of vapor was consistent with standard venting. it was releasing its pressure at the flange not making it out the vent stack.

item.title: Report X-2024021750
item.description:
Report X-2024021750

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found with wet spots on rollers near a load door. No significant leakage was coming from the box. Box was removed from rollers and placed in a tote lined with a Hazmat bag. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the 5 gallon jerrican inside the box was still mostly full, a small leak came from the back side of the round closure when the container was tilted backwards. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed in a tote and moved to Hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024021816
item.description:
Report X-2024021816

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was not loaded properly. The orientation arrows were not facing upwards which helped the leak escape from the bad closure. At discovery, the are was cleared of pkg handlers and the hazmats were transported in a lined hazardous tote to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: The closure is not properly secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg handlers were told of the correct way to load hazmats.

item.title: Report X-2024021741
item.description:
Report X-2024021741

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was punctured at some point on the IC belt heading to the A wing. Nobody knew it was leaking until it got to the A4 side. I was then called to come clean up the spill. DescribePack: The jerrican was leaking through a small hole on the side. The amount it would leak out depend whether or not the package is being move. Small amount if it is sitting still and large amount if it is moving. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I use some absorbents to clean up the spill and placed the leaking package inside a hazmat bag and placed it in a yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021825
item.description:
Report X-2024021825

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021825 SequenceEvent: package was found leaking and was placed in a red damaged tote upside down by an OPS admin to avoid further leaking. package was then taken to the damaged hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: package has a crack running along the radius of the bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red damaged tote upside down to avoid leaking further. 2. X-2024021827 SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and was placed in a red damage tote by a manager. Package was then placed in hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: crack running along a quarter of the circumference of the bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside a red damaged tote upside down to prevent further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024021831
item.description:
Report X-2024021831

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: a manager discovered the package and alerted and OPS admin who placed the package inside a salvage tote and the tote was placed outside the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: package was punctured causing one of the bottles inside to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2024021731
item.description:
Report X-2024021731

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin was walking dock and saw loose bottles spilt from package container. Attempted to put bottles back in box. Liquid contents started to seep out from plastic bottle and leaked into leak prevention bags but ended up going through the bag. Liquid contents spilt within box and on the Admin's leg. Admin had to go to medical location to have leg reviewed for injury as per nurse line call. Remaining contents were able to put back into the original box container. DescribePack: Reinforced tape shows a tear from the inside out which caused the contents to spill out under the belt while still in the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Contents were put into a tote with hazmat liner to contain the corrosive contents that were leaking from the bottles.

item.title: Report X-2024021714
item.description:
Report X-2024021714

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver reported spill of hydrochloric acid package out for delivery. At 1302ET, station employee notified ERTS of a cargo release in Austin, TX. It was reported that an unknown amount of hydrochloric acid released (hazmat spill) for unknown reasons. DescribePack: presumed leak due to cap failure DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: ERTS neutralized hydrochloric acid, and disposed of debris.

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Hazmat was processed then moved by a Tugger cart to be loaded. once it arrived at the trailer, the manager noticed a leak coming from the bottom of the pail. Pail was placed in a plastic Uline bag then placed in a hazmat tote to contain the leak. DescribePack: crack is around the base of the plastic drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Afomage was placed around the base of the drum to neutralize the leak. leak contained by doing this.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver attempted to reposition the truck and trailer after connecting the delivery hoses to the storage tank. When moving the equipment, the connection between the hose adaptor and the storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 10 gallons of gasoline to be released. Lonestar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
